sentence.Network_en: Victorian houses can seem cold with their lofty ceilings and rambling rooms.

sentence.Network_en: There are some delightful Victorian houses fronting onto the pavement.
sentence.Network_cn: 面对人行道有一些漂亮的维多利亚时代的房子。

entry.def: Victorian means belonging to, connected with, or typical of Britain in the middle and last parts of the 19th century, when Victoria was Queen.

example.ex: We have a lovely old Victorian house.
example.tran: 我们有一栋漂亮的维多利亚时代的老房子。
一幅维多利亚时代风格的家庭画像

entry.tran: （尤指对良好行为的评判标准和道德观）有维多利亚时代特点的，传统的
entry.def: You can use Victorian to describe people who have old-fashioned attitudes, especially about good behaviour and morals.

example.tran: 维多利亚时代的价值观受到了严重误解。

entry.tran: （英国）维多利亚(女王）时代的人
entry.def: The Victorians were the British people who lived in the time of Queen Victoria.
